results.definition: put up with something or somebody unpleasant
examples: I cannot bear his constant criticism
The new secretary had to endure a lot of unprofessional remarks
he learned to tolerate the heat
She stuck out two years in a miserable marriage

results.definition: recognize and respect (rights and beliefs of others)
examples: We must tolerate the religions of others

results.definition: have a tolerance for a poison or strong drug or pathogen or environmental condition
examples: The patient does not tolerate the anti-inflammatory drugs we gave him

results.definition: allow the presence of or allow (an activity) without opposing or prohibiting
examples: Children are not permitted beyond this point
We cannot tolerate smoking in the hospital
